family: The Lord of the Rings: Strategy Battle Game
expansions: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: A Shadow in the East
The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Fall of the Necromancer
The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Gondor in Flames
The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Harad
The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Khazad-Dûm
The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Kingdoms of Men
The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Legions of Middle-Earth
The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Mordor
The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Moria & Angmar
The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Shadow & Flame
The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: The Fallen Realms
The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: The Fellowship of The Ring Journeybook
The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: The Free Peoples
The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: The Return of the King Journeybook
The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: The Ruin of Arnor
The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: The Scouring of the Shire
The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: The Siege of Gondor
The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: The Two Towers Journeybook
The Lord of the Rings: Strategy Battle Game – Mordor
Middle-earth Strategy Battle Game: Battle Companies

games.name: De Matrica Bellae
games.description:
De Matrica Bellae is a set of matrix game rules for tabletop wargames by Graham D. Evans and was published as the Society of Ancients incentive game for 2005. The matrix style of play often produces an anarchic type of game and also needs an umpire, but can produce an entertaining game that is good fun and can provide a lot of value to the wargamer. DMB also includes a bonus matrix game campaign, "Londinium's Burning" - a matrix version of the Iceni revolt led by Boudicca.

(from the SOA website)

Matrix games use structured arguments rather than mathematics to determine the success or failure of actions within the game.

games.name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – The Forgotten Age: Expansion
games.description:
“Once more I ventured within those brooding ruins that swelled beneath the sand…”
– H.P. Lovecraft, “The Nameless City”

We think we know the history of the Earth, but there are secrets that lie beyond our reckoning and truths that could undo our entire understanding of the universe. When renowned historian Alejandro Vela discovers one of these secrets, the ruins of an ancient and forgotten Aztec city, it sets into motion a plot that could unravel the very fabric of time.

The Forgotten Age is the third deluxe expansion for Arkham Horror: The Card Game. Here, your team of investigators embark on a scientific expedition to the rainforests of Southern Mexico in two new scenarios, each of which can be played as a standalone adventure or can act as the beginning of a new campaign for your team. This expansion introduces five new investigators to Arkham Horror: The Card Game along with sixty-four player cards and eighty-seven encounter cards, including an all new exploration deck that presents new challenges for you to overcome as you find yourself falling into The Forgotten Age.

—description from the publisher
family: Arkham Horror: The Card Game LCG
expansions: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Heart of the Elders: Mythos Pack
Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Shattered Aeons: Mythos Pack
Arkham Horror: The Card Game – The Boundary Beyond: Mythos Pack
Arkham Horror: The Card Game – The City of Archives: Mythos Pack
Arkham Horror: The Card Game – The Depths of Yoth: Mythos Pack
Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Threads of Fate: Mythos Pack

games.name: S.O.S Tortues
games.description:
S.O.S Tortues is an ecologic game about the marine turtles for 2 to 6 players.

In S.O.S Tortues, each player must protect his specie of turtle and avoid the fisher. If a player lose all his tokens, he becomes a fisher. At the end, the player with the higher number of tokens wins the match.

Each turn, the players can move or stay, when he moves a player must resolve the effects of the arrival square and the face-down card. If he stays, the player draws two face-down cards from the supply, he keeps one card and gives the other card to another player, then the cards effects are resolved. After all players, the fisher(s) move(s) and try to rapt turtles.

games.name: Det Store Norske Familiespillet
games.description:
The Great Norwegian Family Game is a game for the entire family, with questions in two grades of difficulty. A fairly close relative of Trivial Pursuit, the questions come from the Great Norwegian Encyclopedia.

The total of 6200 questions are divided across eight subjects, and offer challenge to any player.

games.name: Piratspelet
games.description:
The rumor says that a treasure is hidden on this island. You have to find it before your opponents do. You have three playing pieces and need to get them to the treasure first, all of them. This is a childrens game.

Contents:
1 Boardgame
12 playing pieces 4x3
1 dice

games.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Here to Serve
games.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Prepare yourself for the conclusion of the Secrets of Oldtown cycle of expansions with Here to Serve for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game. The sixth and final Chapter Pack introduces three copies each of twenty never-before-seen locations, attachments, characters, events, and two plots, spread over all six of Westeros' Great Houses. These cards forge the final links in your Maester's chain, transforming your Maesters into invaluable allies on your path to victory.

Forge your Maester's chain with the Valyrian Steel Link and Brass Link attachments. The theme of these chain links is card advantage: while Valyrian Steel gives you the ability to draw more cards, Brass Link discards cards from your opponent's deck and denies him resources. Here to Serve also features two new plots that boost your strategy, allowing your characters to attack and defend without kneeling during intrigue challenges and raising the claim on intrigue challenges you initiate. Here to Serve introduces a wealth of new deck-building possibilities, especially for decks that feature Maesters.
family: A Song of Ice and Fire
expansions: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game

games.name: Quick Step
games.description:
From the back of the box (translated from German):

Quick Step is a smart amusement game full of surprises for 2 or 4 people. Luck is not determining because it depends very much on where to best move your stone. Each game of QUICK STEP is exciting and full of new contingencies to which you must respond tactically smart and clever.

Quick Step is, as the name implies, a fast, quick lively game that invites to play several games in a row to determine the overall winner.

Setup Quick Step:
With 2 players, each player gets four double-sided pieces (green/red) and builds a tower with it. One player puts all the green sides face up and the other player puts all the red sides up. The towers are then placed in the big starting circle marked with red and green.
With 4 players, the blue/yellow pieces are used also. Setup is the same, but blue and yellow start at the other big circle, playing then in the other direction.

Playing Quick Step:
Roll the Dice. Move one piece that shows your color. If you land on an empty space, turn your piece face down (now the color of your opponent is visible!). If you land on any other piece(s), don't turn your pice face down. All pieces under your piece are now blocked and cannot move until you move your piece away. If you roll a "6", don't turn your piece face dawn, even if you land on an empty space.
It may happen that your color is not visible when it is your turn. Then you just skip your turn. The situation on the board may change and then you can play again.
To reach the end of the track, you have to roll exactly the needed number and you don't turn your piece face down then.

The winner is the person who moves one piece directly into the ending circle.

games.name: Pokémon TCG: Starter Pack Expansion
games.description:
User summary

Starter Pack is a Japanese-language expansion roughly corresponding to the contemporaneous English-language expansion Generations.

The expansion includes 72 cards.

games.name: Weltmeister gegen Europameister
games.description: World Champion Counter Europe Champion: Each player has 1 pawn (boxer) which he moves about the board. Movement is determined by a die. The World Champion begins casting, and then dicing is alternately done. The pips mark the steps that the boxers coming from their respective ring corners, take on the marked way towards each other to come to blows. If the attacker lands on the space occupied by his opponent, it means that he landed him an effective blow and scores a point. The fight lasts 3 rounds or til one boxer is knocked out. Winner of a round will be who has first scored 5 hits.

games.name: SuperPower SmackDown! Battle Dice Game
games.description:
SuperPower SmackDown is a fast-and-furious dice combat game for two or more super-powered heroes!

In SuperPower SmackDown!, each player rolls a set of 5 themed dice -- you can be a Strength hero, a Speed hero, a Gear hero, a Mind hero, or a Mutation hero -- looking for matching icons. Get at least one match, and you can reroll the unmatched dice. Get all 5 to match, and you can roll again.

Whoever gets the most matches "seizes the initiative" and is on the attack that turn. Everybody else rolls for defense. If you roll too low, you lose a die. Reduce your opponents to a single die, and you win the game!

Each die icon has a special power, and the hero cards will also bear the definition of each power.

games.name: Die Fürsten von Catan: Sonderkarte Frühjahr 2012 – Catan Mobil
games.description:
Catan Mobil is the 2012 special card for "The Rivals for Catan".

Ability of the card:
"Wird die Zahl einer angrenzenden Landschaft gewürfelt, erhalten Sie dort einen weiteren Rohstoff. Legen Sie das Catan Mobil danach auf einen anderen Bauplatz, ggf. auch auf einen des Mitspielers. Gibt es keinen, legen Sie es auf die (eigene) Ablage."

In a free translation:
"In case a number of a neighbouring territory came in the dice roll, you receive one extra material from this territory. Place the Catan-mobil in another construction field after that, even in a rival construction field. If there are no free construction fields, place it in your discard pile."

boardgamecompilation._text: Rivals for Catan: Deluxe – Promo Card Pack

family: Die Fürsten von Catan / The Rivals for Catan

games.name: 京都エクスプローラー KYOTO EXPLORER
games.description:
User summary
京都エクスプローラー (KYOTO EXPLORER) is a Japanese card game.

Plan your unique Kyoto sight-seeing plan and compete against other tourists. Should you take time and search for the hidden information? Or should you fix your plan before your rivals?

A Kyoto-ish game filled with tough decisions.

This game is published in Japanese and with English rules. The design group TANSAN worked on the production.

Publisher's summary
京都の有名観光地を巡る自分だけの観光プランを組み立て、他の旅行者達とバトルしましょう。
隠された情報を集めるために粘るか、早く降りて自分のプランを確定させるか、ジレンマが悩ましい京都感のあるゲームです。

games.name: All of Me
games.description:
From the box: All of Me is a fun and healthful game for children Ages 4 - 8. Simple, yet stimulating, it promotes the positive values of life along with color and shape recognition, sequential reasoning, turn taking and even a healthy degree of frustration tolerance.

This one-f-a-kind game, developed by psychologist Dr. Paul R. Gorecki and New Day Enterprises, helps young children develop a healthy attitude about themselves, their emotions and life in general.

Rolling the die (a large foam cube), players move about the graphically interesting game board amid colorful children's activity scenes, following directions and gathering cards which clearly display the meaning of Love, Happiness, Sharing, Caring, Honesty and Friendship.

Players may be lucky enough to climb a tree to the "Nest Rest", glide down the "Water Slide", or go "Finish" space, all the while keeping an eye on their "ALL OF ME" goal and their playmates.

The first child to collect and assemble all six positive value cards on his or her self-character and move on to the "Finish" space wins. Yet, because of what the game teaches, and the active excitement and positive feelings it creates, there are no real "losers" ... only winners ... in "All OF ME"

games.name: Fog & Friction WWII
games.description:
In the Summer of 1944 the Allied invasion of France began, the fate of Europe now lay in the hands of military commanders. As one of those commanders, you must take control of either an Allied or Axis combined arms force and lead them to victory. Will you use cunning and deception to out-think and out-manoeuver your enemy, or rely on tanks and guns to smash through their lines with brute force? You will have to manage your resources carefully, deciding when and how to commit your forces for best effect as you fight across multiple battlefields at once. But no plan survives contact with the enemy, do you have what it takes to overcome the unpredictable Fog & Friction of war and prove yourself as the greatest military commander?

Fog & Friction WWII is a tactical card game that has elements of traditional CCG/LCG games with a deck building component, mixed with the psychology and bluff of games like poker, using hundreds of beautifully designed original cards. Select your deck from a diverse range of historical forces and fight across Western Europe in a war of wits, deception and combat.

games.name: MiniT
games.description:
The idea is to win a MiniT (=Mini-Tennis) Tie-Break.
The game has 56 position cards, 20 running cards, 32 forehand cards, 32 backhand cards.

The game starts with the usual serve of a normal Tie-Break.
The played cards are put down on the table so that a pattern of cards is being developed into the size of a tennis court (8 by 5 cards). Player A starts with his serve. Then the players alternate getting 2 serves, starting with player B.
Play continues to 7 points or until a player leads by 2 points once 7 is reached.

games.name: Robin Hood Game
games.description:
A fast-action race game for younger children, based on the lovable Walt Disney Robin Hood film characters.
A simple dice-rolling game. The object is to get your men safely to Nottingham Castle.

games.name: Word Ladder
games.description: The game originally known as Doublet or Word-links. A player is given a start word and an end word. In order to win the game, the player must change the start word into the end word by creating a new word at each step. To do this a player must either change a letter, add a letter, remove a letter, or rearrange the letters in different order like an anagram.

games.name: Tiki Topple
games.description: Welcome to Tiki Island, home to nine colorful carvings all competing to be the top Polynesian Idol! In the fast-paced game Tiki Topple, players try to maneuver your secret tikis to the top of the line by playing the right combination of action cards. Use a Tiki Up card to move a tiki ahead in line. Tiki Topple sends opponents' tikis tumbling to the back of the pack. But watch out for the sneaky Tiki Toast cards, which knock your tikis off the board! Score the most points and call yourself the Tiki Master.

games.name: Cold Steel & Canister
games.description:
CS&C is a unique design of miniature gaming for land warfare during the Napoleonic Era. Unique, in that unit movement and fire/combat is regulated by the use of a grid square marked playing area. No tape measuring or movement rulers are used. Unit movement and other actions are limited to the cost of a unit’s available Actions Points during each turn phase, as determined during a turn order's sequence of play.

The basic command level is the brigade (consisting of several infantry battalions, cavalry squadrons and/or artillery batteries). At the end of a turn, one or more Brigade Morale roll(s) are made to determine that brigade's willingness to continue the fight (number of rolls is based on the number of units destroyed or currently in "bad order"). The roll(s) determine if that Commander retreats 1 or more squares. The command radius (in squares) is always determined from the respective brigade commander's position or unit objective square (if orders achieved). If a unit starts a turn within "Command Radius," it allows the unit to be issued an order cube, otherwise it must use all of its movement for the turn to try and get back in command. An experienced player can control a division or corps with little difficulty after only playing the game a couple of times.

Players provide their own miniatures and terrain, using any size scale and basing of miniatures (generally 6mm to 28mm range). The general rule figure scale is based upon a 60:1 scale for infantry/Cavalry. The gaming area can be marked by various methods to show grid square designated areas. An optional grided gaming mat can be used as the terrain base.

The initial release of the rules covers the campaign conflict between France and Austria in 1809 (but other nation units from different theaters of operation and time frames fought can easily be adapted for play). There's also a special section for set up of tournament style battles.

games.name: Teenage Mutant Hero Turtles: 3D spel
games.description:
Shredder has a terror plan to destroy the city's entire sewer system. He has filled all water reservoirs with deadly laser balls. His henchmen stand ready at the gates to let the laser balls roll deep into the sewer system and destroy the entire foundation of the city.

The mutant heroes must defeat Shredder at the Technodrome to save the city.

Contents:

1 threedimensional Board
4 Turtle Figures
1 Shredder Figure
6 Sewer Covers
6 Enemies
10 Laserballs
1 sixsided Die
1 foursided Die
1 Rulebook

games.name: Planar Expedition
games.description:
Description from the publisher:

Planar Expedition is a fantasy board game where players will traverse through the lands of Evyllon in search of the planar portal. Upon entering the plane, players will battle their way to challenge and defeat the Supreme and save Evyllon. With a personal quest, along with many side quests and random encounters, players will strategically and heroically fight many different foes using a card based battle system.

games.name: Dust Tactics: Sisters of Demolition
games.description: Some radical young women have decided they will not be at the mercy of anyone anymore. Drawn from all countries and social backgrounds, the Sisters of Demolition are so fed up with this unending conflict that they have devoted themselves to a single fanatical ideal: if men won’t embrace peace, then let them truly understand war. These women will stop this war, even if it means killing all those who allow it to continue.

games.name: Maxim 'Up!
games.description:
(from the box)
Maxim 'Up! could be the new favourite game in house, due to the colourfull blocks, the easy scoring and the exciting and impredictable gameplay!

Make chains with the blocks to form words. Change words by stacking blocks. You steal a word when you place the top-most block. But the stacks grow, so the winning hand changes continuously. You know the most words when the last blocks are played? then you win!

In your turn, either, take a few letters from your personal supply, and form a word with it. Then add it to the growing game board. Like this, some sort of cross-word-board will grow.

You can also play your letters on top of other players' words, to form new words. This way, you can steal their words, and steal their points.
At the end of the game, you see for each word on the board who has played the highest letter of that word, and score a point for each word you own. The person with the highest number of words wins the game!

games.name: Pandemic
games.description:
In Pandemic, several virulent diseases have broken out simultaneously all over the world! The players are disease-fighting specialists whose mission is to treat disease hotspots while researching cures for each of four plagues before they get out of hand.

The game board depicts several major population centers on Earth. On each turn, a player can use up to four actions to travel between cities, treat infected populaces, discover a cure, or build a research station. A deck of cards provides the players with these abilities, but sprinkled throughout this deck are Epidemic! cards that accelerate and intensify the diseases' activity. A second, separate deck of cards controls the "normal" spread of the infections.

Taking a unique role within the team, players must plan their strategy to mesh with their specialists' strengths in order to conquer the diseases. For example, the Operations Expert can build research stations which are needed to find cures for the diseases and which allow for greater mobility between cities; the Scientist needs only four cards of a particular disease to cure it instead of the normal five—but the diseases are spreading quickly and time is running out. If one or more diseases spreads beyond recovery or if too much time elapses, the players all lose. If they cure the four diseases, they all win!

The 2013 edition of Pandemic includes two new characters—the Contingency Planner and the Quarantine Specialist—not available in earlier editions of the game.

Pandemic is the first game in the Pandemic series.

boardgameaccessory._text: Pandemic: Set of Pawns for Roles

expansions: Pandemic: Gen Con 2016 Promos – Z-Force Team Member/Game Convention
Pandemic: Survival Promos – Crisis Mitigator/Relocation Specialist

games.name: The Gamers Constellation
games.description:
At the beginning of the game only the "Moon" tile is on the "night sky" board, and players will progressively add "Stars" tiles to the board. There are 3 different kind of Stars (4, 5 or 6 branches).

Each player has his own secret goal telling the shape of the Constellation he must realize on the board. To be valid, a Constellation must be made of only 1 type of Stars, and must include the Moon tile.

The winner is the first player who has his own Constellation appears on the board.

The Gamers Constellation uses the same game mechanics as Xochintlan and 6x5.

This game is available for free download on the author's website.

Note from the author: After having inserted this game in the BGG database, I realized there's another game named Constellation, from Hans van Halteren and published in 2003. The two games look very similar in many aspects... This is only pure coincidence !
Mine is derived from the original "Fountain of the King" that I originally designed in 1995, which transformed into Xochintlan, then 6x5, and now the Gamers Constellation. I thought this was a great and original idea ... well, my bad !

games.name: Lords of War: Orcs versus Dwarves – Return Fire Booster Pack
games.description:
Containing 10 Kickstarter exclusive reinforcements cards:

2 backwards-attacking Dwarf Marauders
2 backwards-firing Dwarf Sharpshooters
1 backwards-firing Dwarf Balista
2 backwards-firing Goblin Bowpests
2 backwards-firing Orc Catapults
1 backwards-attacking Goblin Spider Rider
expansions: Lords of War: Orcs versus Dwarves

games.name: Star Fleet Battles: Commanders SSD Book #6
games.description:
An expansion for the Star Fleet Battles: Commander's Rulebook.

Contains 47 SSD (Ship System Display) sheets for Star Fleet Battles, included are SDD's for Police Ships, Space Control Ships, Light Tugs and Survey Cruisers.
4-Federation, 6-Klingon, 6-Romulan, 6-Kzinti, 6-Gorn, 4-Tholian, 4-Hydran, 4-Lyran, 1-Wyn, 4-ISC, 1-Civilian Large Ore Carrier and 1-Sheet of Fighter Squadrons for Space Control Ships.

This SSD book is product number TFG3018.
expansions: Star Fleet Battles: Commander's Rulebook Volume II

games.name: Panzer Grenadier: White Eagles
games.description:
White Eagles is a 64-page book supplement to the Panzer Grenadier series, focused on the battles of September 1939, between Poland's defenders and the German and Soviet invaders. There are 40 new scenarios depicting both sides on the attack, battles of cavalry against cavalry, and even a tank battle or two. Plus of course background articles on the armies and weapons involved. This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of Eastern Front and Road to Berlin to enjoy all of the scenarios. White Eagles includes 165 die-cut and mounted playing pieces. Almost all of them represent Polish forces: tanks, cavalry, armored cars, infantry, machine gun, mortar, anti-tank, artillery and of course leaders. The book's format is the same as our very popular Sinister Forces and Fronte Russo books.

This game is part of the Panzer Grenadier series

Expands:

Panzer Grenadier: The East Front




Expanded by:

Panzer Grenadier: First Axis
expansions: Panzer Grenadier: Campaigns and Commanders Vol 1 – War in the East
Panzer Grenadier: Hopeless, But Not Serious
Panzer Grenadier: Battle of the Bulge

games.name: Checker Can: Das Checker Quiz
games.description:
Game description from the publisher:

What's in goat poop? Why do shoes stink? And what makes a hot air balloon rise? These and 1,197 other multiple-choice questions await you in Checker Can: Das Checker Quiz, based on the television show of the same name. For each correct answer, you advance on the scoring track, and the first player to lap the track wins.

games.name: Riga: The Grand Masters
games.description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for day 19.

Includes 8 Grand Master Tiles: Riga, Visby, Stockholm, Tallinn, Danzig, Money, Knight, Merchant.
Also includes a rules sheet in English and German

The tiles are double sided and, except for the Money tile, you use a random side in each game.
The two sides are "MAX" and "1".
You also only use a random 4 tiles per game.

Every time you erect a building you check if you can claim one or more Grand Master Tiles.
The requirements depend on which side of the tile shows.

You can steal MAX tiles if you have more the the required items than the current owner.

Grand Master tiles are scored at the end of the game.
In general it is 4 points to the owner of the tile and 2 points to the player who has the 2nd most number of required items for that tile.
Details vary depending on if you are playing with the MAX or the 1 side.
The Money tile scores a bit differently depending on the number of players.

games.name: Miss Bernard is a Wild Card: My Weird School – The Game
games.description:
In My Weird School, players collect cards to build a crazy five-card sentence on their boards where the first two words rhyme. After three rounds, the player with the most points wins.

—user summary

Welcome to Ella Mentry School, the weirdest elementary school in the history of the world. Things just got even weirder with the arrival of Miss Bernard, a new teacher encouraging kids to say whatever they want... about the other teachers! And that is just what you’ll do in this sentence-building game that proves school can be serious fun and certifiably weird!

—description from the publisher

games.name: Realms of the Unknown
games.description:
Realms of the Unknown is a pencil and paper game where players take on the roles of Nobles or other leaders of a population. They give orders to their troops and population, explore, invade other territory, encourage population growth, etc. One player is the Realm Controller and sets up the Realm in advance, and gives the players the results from their orders. The game is structured in a way similar to PBM games in that the players hand in their orders each day for a time period covering 1 week in the game. There are rules for Population growth and characteristics; resources including livestock, mines, farms, logging, etc; Technology development, and combat. Combat involves a series of formulas taking in as many factors as possible including number and training of troops, armor, troop types, leaders, weather, terrain, and other factors. This results in a modified strength of each force. When these are compared the relative strength determine losses for each side as well as the victor in the battle.

The rules come in two books - Player's Manual and Realm Controller's Manual.

See also the roleplaying game listing Realms of the Unknown

games.name: Endicott Epidemic: Infectious Contagion Expansion #1 – Black Ops
games.description:
From the publisher's website:

MBI won’t let their mistakes haunt them any longer. They know their nuke will wipe out all traces of their crimes when the Countdown ends, but what of the small chance that a survivor escapes with the Hermit and his Intel?

Enter the MBI Black Ops squad, a team of 5 deadly Soldiers under the command of the ruthless Chrissy. Will they pick off any lucky survivors before the Countdown wipes out the rest of them? Or will they fall victim to the heroes much like the horde of Undead surrounding them all?

Introducing a new playable character, CHRISSY: the fair-haired Controller of the Black Ops squad. Ant was once his greatest student until Chrissy's thirst for innocent blood turned the young soldier against his team and into a life of isolation. Now armed with an even deadlier group of 5 Black Ops Soldiers, Chrissy has been sent into the heart of Zombie-infested Endicott with a simple mission from the heads of MBI: kill everyone and everything before it can escape the end of the Nuclear Countdown.

Hidden within the play deck amongst the flesh-craving Undead are the five Black Ops Soldiers. Uncover one, and become marked for execution. Try to fend off the Soldier with all your might until the sneaky assassins slither back into hiding within the remainder of the deck. Beware, once you are marked you run the risk of being executed sooner than you think! Take a breather from combating the Undead in order to attempt to remove the marks; but don't spend too much time to yourself - every attempt to remove a mark, whether successful or not, will cost you some of your slain Zombies.

When the time comes, Chrissy will send out the command to his Soldiers to EXECUTE! Roll the die when the command is drawn; the matching marks are instantly executed and players take damage (potentially fatal, if you have a hard time removing your marks). But that's not all - sometimes the Execute commands will allow more than one Soldier to execute their marks, spelling certain doom for any players who have unwillingly collected a variety of marks from several different Soldiers. If you fall victim to one of the Soldiers, respawning is no longer an option. You are instantly killed and any Cure cards you were holding become compromised with the Solders' evil decoy-deception. Now your allies must roll a successful Cure Retrieval value TWICE before they can take the Cure card and win the game.

Despite their advantages in both stealth and strength, the Black Ops Soldiers are still only human. If you can manage to do so, killing one will reward you dearly - not in points and not in monetary value, but with the knowledge that you and your comrades can walk the desolate streets of an apocalyptic Endicott with a bit more safety. But beware - the Zombies still run amok, and they LOVE adrenaline-pumped prey!

Contents:

18 Game Cards
88 5/8" Chits
7 Game Mats
1 Full Color 2-sided rules sheet

games.name: Pirates of the Caribbean
games.description: This track game, based on the theme park ride, is part of the Disneyland series of games. On your turn you roll the die and move along the track the number of spaces indicated. You may try to get a Treasure card by moving onto one of the branch tracks leading to a pirate holding a treasure chest. If you roll a number printed on the chest you take a card. Some cards show gold and are needed to win, others show Tiny (the fat lady at the auction) or a pirate in the dungeon and are worthless but are kept so that opponents don't know how many treasures you have. Landing on a peg leg pirate space forces you to lose a treasure. The first player with 2 treasures to reach the end of the boat track by exact count wins.

games.name: Pendoka
games.description:
Pendoka is a set of small wooden spheres and plastic connectors. The spheres have four holes each, so you can build dodecahedrons and different three-dimensional structures with penta- and hexagons, varying the possible forms, twisted and shrinked ... the fact you can turn the connectors even if it is already sticking in a hole, offers many ways for construction.

There are different kinds of games you can play with Pendoka, from easy to difficult:
At "Master of Pentagon" the players get a certain number of colored spheres and connectors, each player his own color. The goal is to build after a couple of rules and hinder the others from building. Winner is the first player who built all his parts.

At "Fünferkette" (five-in-a-row) the winner is, who built the first five of his parts in a row, at "Your Turn" you have to enclose a sphere of the contrary player ...

There are even more Games in it, so Pendoka is not a single game of its own, but more a system, like Spiel (with hundreds of dice) - you can create your own rules, build as you want or have a look on the website for new ideas.

Home Page: http://www.pendoka.de

games.name: Operation Pedestal: Malta Convoy, August 1942
games.description:
An expansion for Rise of the Luftwaffe this module is found in RBM/GMT's C3i Magazine Nr10.

This module recreates Operation Pedestal, a British convoy attempting to resupply the island, and the German attacks on the convoy.

games.name: Worlds of Heroes & Tyrants Card Expansion #1: Frozen in Time
games.description:
First card-pack expansion for the "World of Heroes and Tyrants" board game. Consists of a new character (Froll, starts in Flint, IN 4 FT 8 ST 4 DX 5 HP 50 SB 11, advantage is to start the game with five slaves) and forty Encounter Cards (fifteen gray, fifteen yellow, and ten red).

This expansion's designer is uncredited but is presumably Bruce P. Dowrie, designer of the main game.

Expands:

Worlds of Heroes & Tyrants

games.name: Orléans: Neue Ortskarten N°3
games.description: Orleans: Neue Ortskarten N°3 ("Place Tiles N°3") is a mini expansion for Orléans that consists of three new place tiles: Port, Quarry, and Workshop (Hafen, Steinbruch, und Werkstatt).

games.name: Legend: Winds of war 1934-1940
games.description:
The first official expansion for the Legend: History of 1000 Miglia game. Not only it introduces 18 brand new cars, but it TOTALLY reimplements the base game: new dashboards for the base game cars are included in the expansion, so you can play the base game using the new rules.

IMPROVEMENTS:

Now cars are balanced on the base of a yearly budget each player can use to buy the car, the driver (who gives bonus on racing) and spare parts.

Cars are more accurately designed and feature different and peculiar curve speeds so they do not ride the track in the same way and the difference between cars fast on straights and those faster on winding roads is much more significant and influences the fate of the race.

12 Single tracks and races have been included to play the game in one session, as well as the chance to race the entire Mille Miglia in one session of approximately 3 hours.

Using the single tracks, drivers can play the Italian Racing Championship and evolve their racing team year by year purchasing new cars and drivers.

No more calculations or writings, yet the same accuracy. Now the time track is kept with the use of a in-game clock.

Several others improvements to balance and make the game more fluid and enjoyable.

games.name: Blight of the Living Dead
games.description:
This is a game based off of a map product, Master Plan: Necropolis, also published by UKG. In "Blight of the Living Dead", up to six players can act as fantasy adventurers seeking out the Lord of the Night (also a player) in the necropolis while battling undead minions and searching chests for treasure that will aid them.

It is a simple game with combat handled by opposed die rolls with variable undead reinforcement also handled by dice.


NOTE: You MUST have the Master Plan: Necropolis product (or just make your own) to make use of this game! **

games.name: Unsere Brummer
games.description:
Objective: Be the first reaching space 100
- moving by turns -
typical Roll&Move/Snakes&Ladders game; due to the WWI theme indoctrination and glorification are 'added values';
notes:
published during WWI;
impressive drawings.

games.name: Haulomancy
games.description:
Haulomancy is set in a Fantasy Steampunk world full of cogs, crystals, and currency. The Grand Wizard Council has just allowed the construction of a permanent transportation network, asking each race to send their best Hauler to pioneer this feat. You are that Hauler. Build Track. Upgrade Transport. Avoid Sabotage. Welcome, to the world of Haulomancy.

In Haulomancy, Haulers are tasked with putting in place a system of rails that connect the worlds major cities together, allowing for faster trade between the nations. To do this players will physically draw track on the board between points, with cost increasing with distance drawn. Haulers will also take to steel, skies, or seas in order to deliver goods to keep their coffers fat and their empire afloat.

To secure the final round, Haulers must have a rail network that connects to the major cities, as well as having fully paid off a steep loan from the Goblin Bank. One final round is played, and the richest Hauler wins.

games.name: Frederick the Great
games.description: 56 pages of miniatures rules and 6 pages of tables for the Seven Years War with rules for adapting to the American Revolution and the Age of Marlborough. Scale is 50 men or two guns per figure, 50 yards per inch, and 10 minutes per turn. No scenarios, but several pages of general army lists.

games.name: Three Cheers for Master
games.description:
Master has been blue lately. It's just not the same now that all lands known to evil have been conquered — and when Master's blue, it's the minions who suffer.

As a lieutenant in Master's army — a foreminion — it falls to you to cheer him up. Not the easiest task, even in the best of times. But then it hit you: What better way to cheer Master up than a cheerleading competition?

Whichever foreminion builds and scales the most impressive tower of war-hungry minions in Three Cheers for Master will surely win Master's heart. What could possibly go wrong?
expansions: Three Cheers For Master: Bookmark of Literal Undermining
Three Cheers for Master: Feats Expansion
Three Cheers for Master: Phil A. Minion
Three Cheers for Master: Santa Claws

games.name: Addition Bingo
games.description: Addition Bingo is a children's educational game, made to teach children the very basics of addition.

games.name: Lion's Share
games.description: The object of this game is to score points by matching as many safari animals as possible. An entire deck of cards is dealt, and players fan out cards in their hands without showing them to the others. Before play begins, each player matches pairs (or sets of four) from their hands and places the matches face-up in front of them. Players then make new matches using the other player's pairs. The game ends when all possible matches are complete. The player who collects the most points wins. This game encourages fine motor skills (handling a fan of cards), concentration, and sorting and sequencing, and it promotes interactive play and social skills. The game includes 44 safari animal cards, one lion card, one vulture card, and instructions.

games.name: Dux Bellorum
games.description:
From Osprey's publicity:

The Dark Age of Britain, from the middle of the 4th century to the end of the 8th, was a time of violence and warfare, when charismatic warlords such as the fabled King Arthur could gather together armies and carve out their own kingdoms. With this new set of wargames rules, players can take on the role of these warlords and command their own armies on the tabletop. Written by the author of the popular Glutter of Ravens rules set, Dux Bellorum is an element-based system, where each base of figures represents 50 fighting men. Each player has a specific number of points with which to construct his force and can choose to a Late Roman, Romano-British, Welsh, Saxon, Pictish, Irish, or Sea Raider army. The game is then played out following a set of simple, fast-paced rules. A completely self-contained gaming system, Dux Bellorum is perfect for gamers who are looking for a way into fighting Dark Age battles without investing a lot of time or money in larger rulesets.

From the playtest introduction:

Dux Bellorum is an Arthurian-era Dark Ages wargame, set in the period from the mid fourth century AD to the end of the eighth century AD. The rules emphasise the influence an army’s commander has on his units, with simple manoeuvre rules and chaotic, swirling close combat. You'll win by inspiring the right troops at the right time, balancing quality versus quantity in your army, and by finding a sprinkling of luck at the right time.

All distances are given in Base Widths, which allows the game to be used with any scale of miniature based in many different ways. An army usually has 6-12 units, and each unit is rated for Aggression (Attacks), Protection (Defence), and Cohesion (Strength) and is trained either as Shieldwall, Warriors, Riders, or Skirmishers (all of which operate differently in the game).

Dux Bellorum armies are selected from following lists: Late Roman, Romano-British, Welsh, Saxon, Pictish, Irish, Land Raider, Sea Raider.
family: The Legend of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table

games.name: Martian Empires
games.description:
Martian Empires is a set of Fast Play rules for Victorian Science Fiction Games using 15mm figures. It has been written to accompany the Martian Empires range of 18mm figures also sold by Black Hat Miniatures. The rules are in full colour throughout and run to 52 pages plus the cover. They include the full rules, army lists and five scenarios.

Each player commands an army of figures, depicting terrestrial or Martian troops, mounted onto stands (recommended frontage 40mm for 15/18mm figures). Ranges are determined by measurement (no grid), firing and close combat are resolved by dice rolls. Leaders are needed to order troops and vehicles to move, but soldiers sensibly fire at visible enemies on their own initiative. Victory or defeat conditions are scenario-based.

games.name: Heart of Crown: Northern Enchantress
games.description:
Heart of Crown: Northern Enchantress is the second expansion for Heart of Crown. It requires either the base game or the Fairy Garden expansion to play and may be integrated with other Heart of Crown expansions.

The set contains 72 cards:

1 new Princess Card: Anastasia, Witch of the Northern Limits
13 new types of Common Card (5 of each type)
1 Revised Princess Card from the Far East Territory expansion (Ouka, Far East Mathematician Princess)
1 Revised Common Card from the Far East Territory expansion, Samurai (5 copies)

games.name: Finders keepers!
games.description:
There is a large board with hundreds of different images shown. This board can be assembled in a variety of ways. Players pull tokens that have a single picture on them from a bag and attempt to find the picture on the board. Players can choose two version os play. Either pull one token out and all players attempt to find it at the same time, or each player can draw a few tokens out of the bag and the first to find all of their pictures on the board wins.

In this game the players play cats that tries to find different objects. The board has a lot of images on it (around 300), you draw a card with an image on it. You then try to find it on the board and move there.

games.name: 18SA
games.description:
18SA is an 18xx game which is set in South America.

The players are seeking to make the most money by buying and selling stock certificates of eleven railroad companies. The player with the most stock of a particular company in his possession acts as the president of this company and is responsible for track laying, the placement of railheads (which are necessary for train runs), route selection and train acquisition. Running trains earns money and this money is either divided by the shareholders or kept in the company's treasure for further investments (like buying better trains or constructing track). This decision influences the value of the company's shares - and not the player with the most stock or the most beautiful constructed track wins the game, but the player with the most riches in terms of cash and shares.

The game differs from the usual 18xx games a little, as it uses different tokens for either passenger trains or freight trains. The companies also face a lot of building costs - mountains, Amazonas swamps, and crossing a border into another country costs extra.

games.name: Carcassonne: Hero at the Crossroads & Baba Yaga
games.description:
Каркассон: Богатырь на распутье & Избушка (Carcassonne: Hero at the Crossroads & Baba Yaga) is a two-tile expansion for Carcassonne made by Russian publisher Hobby World and presented to participants of the Russian national Carcassonne league in 2013. One tile represents Bogatyr, a Russian hero from folktales, at a crossroads, while the other tile represents Izbushka, the small hut of Baba Yaga the witch, also from Russian folktales.

Bogatyr's tile has no special rules, but it does feature text on a stone that might be translated as follows:

If you go to the left - you'll find death.
If you go to the right - you'll lose your horse.
If you go straight - you'll live, but will forget who you are.

The Izbushka tile scores somewhat like an anti-cloister as it's worth 1 point for the tile itself and 1 additional point for each empty space around the tile, for a maximum of 8 points.

games.name: Nile
games.description:
In the game of Nile, you and your opponent are rival builders of the great pyramids, using your workers to collect resources and build pyramids.

Nile is a 2-player worker placement game where players compete for resources and workers in order to build the best and most pyramids. Played with Icehouse pyramids, Nile is one of the first Euro-style games to come out of the Icehouse system.

Rules here: http://icehousegames.org/wiki/index.php?title=Nile

games.name: Vinegar Hill
games.description:
Vinegar Hill is a low complexity wargame covering the Australian Castle Hill Convict Rebellion of 1804. The game includes an 11x17 map, countersheet, and 3 pages of rules. The game is based on Peter Schutze's Eureka Stockade.

Each player has an objective that he or she must meet in order to win - either number of units destroyed or occupying certain hexes. Each counter can move one hex per turn. The combat is a simple system in which the players must roll greater than or equal to the number printed on the counter to achieve a hit.

games.name: Talk About
games.description:
Players talk as fast as they can in 20 seconds to guess the 10 hidden clue words that are all related to the “Subject” word displayed at the top of the card displayed on the game board.

The first team’s number of unguessed words determines how many clues the second Team will get to see in their attempt to guess a new “Subject” word.

For example: Team A guesses 7 out the 10 words under the subject of “Pizza.” The total score for this round will eventually be 7 points, but we don’t yet know which Team has won those points…

In our example, Team B is allowed only three clue words (10-7) on a new card to guess what the “Subject” of that card is. If Team B correctly guesses the new Subject from those clues, they win the points for the round (7, in this case). If Team B fails to identify the subject, Team A wins those points.

The game continues with Teams switching roles--Team B will try to guess the 10 hidden clue words on a new card. Team A will follow with using a limited number of words to guess a new Subject.

Talk About is a faithful adaptation of an Canadian television game show, whose gameplay seems to have been inspired by the board game Outburst!.

games.name: Firestorm Invasion: Special Ops
games.description:
Lastly, but by no means least, comes the gritty art of daring special operations. Small teams of highly trained troops going man-to-man against the best your enemy can throw at you. Capture a bunker, rescue hostages, eliminate a target or destroy a shield generator - this is what your elite troops trained for. We call this SPECIAL OPS and it will be presented using 28mm scale miniatures.

Source: Publisher blurb

Special Ops is third, and final tabletop wargame in Firestorm Invasion family. It uses dice and 28mm to recreate small scale special operations during final phase of planet invasion in Firestorm Armada universe.

Each player control small force made from 28mm miniatures and tries to fulfil scenario objective or smash his opponent.

games.name: Family Guy: Stewie's Sexy Party Game
games.description:
Family Guy: Stewie's Sexy Party Game is a hilarious, fast-paced word game of questionable social value...not really suitable for anyone. Spin the spinner! Earn martinis! Offend your friends and relatives!

Each round, a new player is Stewie, the host of the party. Stewie spins the spinner to determine the theme of the party and draws a party card. Stewie's guests help throw the party by offering word cards to fill in the blanks of the party card. Guests score martinis by collecting sets of Family Guy characters on their word cards; Stewie scores martinis when the guests agree that the completed party card matches the theme. When the booze runs out, the party is over and the player with the most martinis wins!
expansions: Family Guy: Mouth full of BLANKS

games.name: Ouroboros
games.description:
Ouroboros is an abstract strategy game for 2-4 players, best with 2 players. Players start with no discs, and gain discs from other players during gameplay.

Ouroboros is played on a 6x6 grid filled with four-colors of randomly placed discs. On each player's turn, they do one of three things:
1) Choose a square with a disc in it to place a stone there, taking the disc from that square and giving away the discs orthogonally or diagonally adjacent, OR
2) Remove two stones from the board matching a pattern and discard many discs in specific amounts, OR
3) Discard one disc.

The winner is the first person to get back to zero discs (after the first turn).

games.name: Bushido: Shizuka
games.description:
Shizuka is a master of the shadows, her cautionary personality ensures her ideal mission is played out clean and without contact with the enemy.

As a worm Shizuka waited until the day before her twelfth birthday to launch an attack on an adept. She had been courted for a number of worm squads over the years and as time passed many thought she wouldn’t have the stomach for it. They assumed she was destined, despite her promise, to join the ranks of the Genin. Little did they know Shizuka was merely biding her time. Her waiting game paid off, she spent the time learning the strengths and weaknesses of her peers and assembled a squad she could be sure of.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.

games.name: Have a Go!
games.description:
British card game from the 1950's. The cards all feature famous people and are extremely weird. Then you realise they are photographs taken at Madame Tussauds of some of their waxwork figures.

Rules
1. Each player contributes one unit into a kitty.
2.The dealer deals the players seven cards each, then places the remainder of the pack face down in the middle.
3.Each player in turn takes a card from the top of the pack and discards one unwanted card from his hand, laying it down face up by the pack.

The first player who collects either
(a) two runs,
(b) a run and three or four of a kind,
(c) two sets of three and four of a kind,
(d) a complete run,
and lays them face up on the table, wins, and receives one unit from each player.
The first player who collects the cards “HAVE A GO” and lays them face up on the table takes the kitty and collects two units from each player.
4. A run can only consist of cards of the same colour, e.g. brown CDE or brown CDEF.
5. If a player wins by completing a run of all cards in his hand, as in rule 3 (d), then each player pays him two units.
6. The card which has been discarded by the last player can only be picked up by the next player if it enables him to finish, otherwise he must take one from the top of the pack.
7. When all cards in the pack have been picked by the players and no player has yet won, the pack of discarded cards are shuffled and stacked face down, play proceeding as before.

games.name: Rise to Nobility: Beyond
games.description:
In Rise to Nobility: Beyond you will collect and guard precious Relics, give offerings to the Timeless Temple, and help the kingdom’s Elders so they can grant you favors or permanently win their endorsement in your path to become a Noble citizen of the Five Realms.

During that time you will have access to the Realms precious mineral, the Rock Rose, which will present you the opportunity to trade it for Goods, Coins, earn you the Queen’s reputation and more, but like anything else that is precious, it comes in limited quantities so be careful how you spend it.

Rise to Nobility: Beyond introduces new ways to score points, a twist to the reputation mechanic and tableau building aspect that adds high replayability to the game.

games.name: La course des Gumballs
games.description:
Contents : 4 pawns shaped like gumball machines full of coloured plastic balls, 1 board with coloured circles.

When you push a pawn down, all balls inside your gumball goes down except one. You must then move your gumball to the nearest circle of this colour. The white ball is a joker, and some circles allows you to move faster (bridges) or slower (sticking gum). The first to pass the arrival line wins.

games.name: Kerosene
games.description:
From the publisher (translated):
The first oil field in the world has just been discovered, the first oil companies have just been founded, one of the largest industries worldwide is about to unfold. John Davison Rockefeller is managing to achieve form the largest monopoly that no one has ever created.

Players will play the control of one of these pioneering companies, and must make all kinds of investments to keep the various production processes in the oil industry: extraction, refining, transportation or distribution. These should think how to get the most bargaining power possible as players buy each other directly, so absolutely real simulating the oil market at the time.

The game consists of 5 rounds which comprise more than 120 years of history since the rise of oil in 1870 until the end of the Cold War in 1991.

Historical events create an atmosphere that completely surrounds the players and fully immersed in the stifling world of the oil business.

Players who can create the most profitable company will be declared the winner.

From the publisher (Spanish):
El primer yacimiento de petróleo del mundo acaba de ser descubierto, las primeras empresas petroleras acaban de ser fundadas, uno de las mayores industrias a nivel mundial está a punto de desarrollarse. John Davison Rockefeller está ingeniándoselas para lograr formar el mayor monopolio que nunca nadie haya creado jamás.

Los jugadores desempeñarán el control de una de estas empresas pioneras, y deberán realizar todo tipo de inversiones para quedarse con los distintos procesos productivos de la industria petrolera: extracción, refinado, transporte o distribución. Para ello deberán pensar la manera de obtener el mayor poder de negociación posible, ya que los jugadores se comprarán unos a otros directamente, simulando de forma absolutamente real el mercado de petróleo de la época.

El juego consta de 5 rondas que comprenderán más de 120 años de historia desde el surgimiento del petróleo en el año 1870 hasta el final de la Guerra Fría en el año 1991.

Los eventos históricos crean una ambientación que rodea por completo a los jugadores y que los introduce de lleno en el asfixiante mundo de los negocios petroleros.

El jugador que logre crear la empresa más rentable será declarado ganador.

games.name: Alakazam!
games.description:
Welcome to Robert Houdin’s theater! The most famous magicians in the world come here to prove themselves. You will have to show your skills in card, coin and stage magic. Will you gain the audience’s favor or will this be your last performance?

Alakazam! is a fast-paced card game for 2 to 6 players. Players are dealt a hand of cards with a set of three magic tricks in each. In every turn, each player has to play a card that has a better trick than the one performed by the previous player. They must pass if they don't have a card with a better trick.

The first player to perform all his tricks wins the game.

games.name: Ships of the Line
games.description:
This is a cardgame for 2 player.
It's a war between ships of the period XV-XVII sec.
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
Every ship has values for: Ship, Ropes, Equipment.
Move your ship fast and be the first to hit down enemy ship.
To win you have to reduce one of the characteristic of opponent ship to 0.

games.name: Let's Go to Campmeeting
games.description:
"Meetings, hikes, choir practice, fire duty, and a baptism. All the fun, excitement, and spiritual renewal of a true to life campmeeting."

Players draw destination cards and roll the dice to proceed to that location. Upon arriving at their destination, players read and follow the instructions and when finished draw a new destination card. Players earn souls for completing tasks and arriving at destinations.

Play continues until "The Last Day of Campmeeting" card is drawn.

The player who has collected the most souls, wins that game.

games.name: Ski Run: The Ultimate Skiing Board Game
games.description:
Ski Run is an action packed race across the mountain where you try to be the first player back to the resort for Apres Ski! A quick interactive game for all the family.

Pick your route across the piste map board by riding up lifts and racing down runs, whilst trying not to Wipe Out! Will you take the easy blue, the intermediate red or the more direct but difficult black run? Watch out for ice, whiteouts, jumps and the big freeze, whilst hopefully avoiding getting lost or colliding with your competitors. Chase the yeti to find his shortcuts and hire skidoos or heliski to catch up. Call a stop at a ski station to delay your rivals and keep your eye out for opportunities to jump the queues or follow the leader.

The lead changes constantly in this dynamic game of fluctuating fortunes, where you try to use the right cards at the right time to stay one step ahead of your opponents. A quick, brilliant, interactive game for all the family.

Contents: Piste map board, 16 ski run cards, 10 lift cards, 20 event cards, 4 special cards and 5 wipe out cards, 12 sided snowball dice, rules sheet, playing counters.

games.name: WTF (Where's The Fun?)
games.description:
From the publisher:

WTF is, on the surface, a game about cards and points. You play a card, you gain or lose some points, and the player with the most points when the GAME OVER card is played wins. But there's a catch or two: First, the GAME OVER card is double-sided, so everyone knows where it is at all times. Second, over half of the cards in WTF contain blanks and you get to fill them in and finish the rules! You might get a card that lets you determine how many points players gain or lose, or you might get a card that lets you require all players to perform some ridiculous task of your choosing. Each card simply must follow on the "suit" of the previous card -- but many of the suits are made up by the players as they play! The big catch is that you actually write on the cards each game, so your deck is always changing. The result is that the card that seemed funny when it made the player to your left eat his own earwax is a lot less funny when it comes back around to the player on your right! For even more excitement, you can mix up your deck with another friend's deck and see what happens. It’s up to everyone to decide how far you have to go to get points and keep the GAME OVER card out of the point leader’s hand.

games.name: Goldräuber
games.description:
Goldräuber is a fast, exciting, cooperative game with simple rules for 1-4 players, which are also understood by small treasure hunters from 8 years up. Thanks to the solo player variant a lonely brave miner can play Goldräuber even if there are no other pitmen around.

Goldräuber is a cooperative game in which the players try to find the legendary treasure of the mountain as well as a lost miner and bring it back to light. The mountain consists of 24 cards.

The players decide together from where they want to enter the mine. Alternating is diced and considered whether to turn over a face-down card, to move the pawn to an already-revealed card, or to chop a stone wall that blocks the path.

As if the way into the mountain was not already arduous enough, the guardian of the treasure can break down a gallery from time to time.

Only with courage, with the smart planning and the necessary little bit of luck the gold rushers can succeed in returning to daylight with their loot.

games.name: King Cat
games.description:
You will gain control of 1 of 4 unique Cat Kingdoms seeking dominance of your the home. Control your stores of Catnip, Recruit Knight Cats, Fulfill Secret Royal Decrees, Raise your Kingdom's Instinct, Honor, and use your cat army to conquer Territory, Toys, and Food for command of Victory Points.

The Kingdom with the most victory points wins!

This game combines hand and resource management, set collection, and competitive and cooperative play.

Tremendous replay value and family fun appeal with colorful components and a cute theme parodying the lives of our furry cat friends.

—description from the publisher

games.name: Kingsburg: Wheel and Deal
games.description:
From Fantasy Flight's Website :

"The people of the Realm are variegated: there are lazy nobles and skilled craftsmen, fiery soldiers and humble peasants. A wise governor knows which group to favour at the right time to get as many benefits as possible for his own career."

This official scenario for "Kingsburg" allows the players to choose archetype roles each years to specialize their talents.

games.name: Space Cadets: Dice Duel Drive Thru Promo
games.description:
The Drive Thru token for Space Cadets: Dice Duel will allow players to heal their Capital Ship once per game.

To start the game, drop the token from 1 foot above the board. If it lands equally in between a grid space, players agree which grid will hold the token. During the game, players may stop on the token with their Capital Ship. Fighters have no interaction with the token. Players must stop exactly on the token, and shout "Pit Stop!". The Capital Ship will heal the last damage received. Players will remove the last energy crystal or retrieve the last energy die. Discard the token from game.

games.name: Game for Fame
games.description:
Game for Fame is the party board game that separates the A-List from the Zzz-List, and just like the real world of celebrity you don't need any talent to win.

Work towards the red carpet (and avoid Re-hab) by working in teams in a number of fun games such as trying to talk with your tongue hanging out your mouth or guess which accent your team is attempting. But don't get too friendly, as players also have to backstab their team mates for solo cash prizes.

In Game For Fame there can only be one winner, the player with the most money.

games.name: Casino Las Vegas
games.description:
This game is played on a round-course like Monopoly. You have to draw cards for special events and you can purchase 1 of 6 casinos when landing on their space.

But this is only one part of this game. Every time a player lands of the numerous casino-game spaces, he can "enter" the casino and play poker, craps, Chicago, (mini-)Roulette and blackjack. If the casino belongs to another player, the owner of the casino plays the bank!

Interesting, that the casino card games are played with a 32 skat deck...

games.name: Matakana
games.description:
Matakana is a game for 3 to 5 players of planting seeds, harvesting vegetables and selling them to customers at the bustling Matakana market.

Players will compete for sunshine, soil & gnomes (of course!) in a race to plant seeds and create the most bountiful garden. Those vegetables are then harvested and taken to the local market where players sell to the waiting customers.

A game of Matakana takes place over rounds of two distinct phases: Gardening & Harvesting.

GARDENING PHASE



In the Gardening phase, players will compete with each other to take a row of cards that will allow them to cultivate their garden. The cards that players collect are:

1) Gnome cards - allows players to collect gnomes which act as a currency of sorts when planting seeds

2) Soil cards - allows players to take soil tiles and lay them in their garden (soil tiles come in various shapes and sizes and you will need them before you can plant any seeds)

3) Sunshine cards - dictates which columns in your garden you are able to plant seeds in this round.

Depending on the draw of the cards some rows will be more lucrative than others and it will be up to the players to decide when is time to compete for those cards. Once players have collected their cards they will lay soil and plant seeds according to those cards.

HARVESTING PHASE



The second phase of the round involves rolling 3 regular dice to determine which column of your garden will harvest vegetables. The player rolling the dice choices a pair of dice from the roll and the sum of those dice is the column in the garden that all players can harvest. Players then take vegetable cards that match the seeds they have planted into their hand.

Players will now have an opportunity to openly trade with each other for vegetables that they do not have. Players will do this to sell a certain group of vegetables to waiting customers at the local market. The market is a 9x9 grid made up of 9 customers of varying colours. Each of these customers is wanting different combinations of vegetables and the players who can serve that customer with the vegetables that they are wanting will take that "Customer" and place it face up in front of them.

SCORING



Once the deck of Customers runs out the game will end and players will tally up their scores. Points are given for:

1) Creating full columns of seeds in their garden
2) Having the majority of Customers of a certain colour (with points available for those in 2nd and 3rd)
3) Having the most money at the end of the game

To do well in Matakana requires a player to do well in all areas of the game: creating a bountiful garden that harvests often, trading wisely with other players to ensure you have the vegetables that you need and finally, keeping an eye on what customers other players are serving so that you can maximize your scoring opportunities.

A game of Matakana takes approximately 60-90 minutes and players 3-5 players.

games.name: BattleAxe
games.description:
BattleAxe
by Nick Ryan

BattleAxe is an dark age battlefield warefare simulation tabletop game for 2 players (or 2 teams) that allows the players to use their strategic skills against each others armies. The main goal is to kill the opponent's King. Each army consists of 26 numbered men, 2 warhorses. Your army including axe-men, spearmen, swordsmen, archers, an engineer, horsemen and 1 king, all with different and balanced attributes. The fighting/attacking mechanism is an elegant 1 to 3 custom dice rolling system. Each player has the exact same army, similar to Chess, as to see which player really has superior strategic skills. Asymmetrical games can also be played with endless scenarios.

Each player has an "Army Map" sheet for his army which illustrates and keeps track of each warrior and warhorse. Each man in your army has his own health meter, skills, attributes, and even a place for the player to name them. This gives an unparalleled up-close-and-personal view from the battlefield. Engineers are a big part of the game, they can cut down trees, construct archer towers to enhance their attack range, walls, fire trenches and even make extra arrows for your archers. The concept of fire, from fire arrows and fire trenches symbolized by "wild fire" tiles are also a big part of the game. Fire can spread and take down your walls and towers which creates a real feel of the chaos of war.

It's who the better strategic commander is, not who can level up faster with fairy dust and gold coins.
It's dividing and concurring enraged enemy forces, not gathering grain for the winter.
It's swiftly destroying the opposing King and all his men to become the one true King of the battlefield.
It's BattleAxe.

games.name: Jim'll Fix It
games.description:
Game based on a popular television show where Jimmy Saville (an eccentric disc jockey) fulfils viewer's ambitions. If you were lucky and picked for the show, you not only fulfilled your ambition, you were also awarded a Jim Fixed It For Me badge. This became a much sought after item.

The players are children, wanting to have an ambition accepted. A 'Jim' playing piece starts life on the board and is moved by a Jim spinner. The player moves by a normal die. The objective is to land exactly on the same square as Jim. If you do, you draw four cards. The cards say things like "I would like", "I wish" etc., and also the subject of a dream wish, something like water-skiing or flying. If you can make a legitimate statement out of the four cards, you win. But this is unlikely on the first attempt and you will need to meet Jim again. If you do, you add two cards to your original four and again try to form a legitimate statement. If you can't, you discard two cards and you will have to meet Jim again.

The first player to fulfil a request with their cards, wins.

games.name: Zodiac Attack
games.description:
Author's description

Two-player arcade dogfighting for your table! Every turn your bullets move in the direction they're fired. Zip around the map, fire your bullets and be the last animal standing.

User summary

The game is played on a large grid play surface with boundary edges. Players alternate turns. During a player's turn they move their token and may fire a projectile (each projectile is fired in one of eight directions). After each player moves and fires, all projectiles move one square in the direction of their invariable travel. Projectiles that move into an occupied square "hit" the object in the square and become expended. Player tokens that are thus hit incur damage. Note that projectiles do not "belong" to one player or another, and it is possible for players to "shoot themselves".

The goal of the game is to remain alive longer than your opponent. The first player destroyed loses; the other player wins.

Anything that "moves off" the right side of the play surface reappears on the left side of the play surface; anything that "moves off" the top of the play surface reappears on the bottom of the play surface, etc., in a mode common to many old video arcade games. Thus, as turns progress the grid becomes increasingly encumbered with projectiles (insuring that impacts occur increasingly frequently).

games.name: Politiko (2nd Ed)
games.description:
It’s election time! (Finally)
POLITKO is a card game about wacky scheming, cynical realpolitik—in other words, it is a game about winning the Malaysian general election!

Janji ditepati! (Promises fulfilled)
Woo voters with cash handouts, hudud law, or petrol subsidies.

Pencapaian diutamakan! (Performance First)
Hire phantom voters. Control the media. Cook up a sex scandal to alienate your enemy’s supporters or betray your own allies!

Lawan tetap lawan! (Let's Fight For Victory!)
Choose from 9 distinct (and familiar) political parties to lead to victory.

1Malaysia!
Play with up to 6 friends, of any race. But are they really your friends? Remember: it’s not about the people. It’s about Putrajaya.

HOW TO PLAY:
In Politiko, you are the leader of a Malaysian Political Party, To win, your party must be the first to have 8 voter cards.

Every player chooses one PARTY. Shuffle the rest of the deck and deal 7 cards to each player.

On your turn, you:
1) Draw 2 cards from the deck
2) Either:
- Play any number of VOTERS into your Party VOTER deck. There must comply with your Party voter restrictions (eg. by race, demographics and liberal/conservative)
OR
- Play 2 Schemes (Action cards). Schemes allow you to discard cards from others, steal cards etc. You may also form Alliances, trade cards with allies, or withdraw from Alliances.
3) Discard down to 7 cards in your hand

games.name: Munchkin Dungeon: Dungeon of Superior Shopping
games.description:
The Dungeon of Superior Shopping is a promotional item from Steve Jackson Games that can be used with any Munchkin expansion that contains Dungeons. This item is larger than other Dungeons (6"x4" instead of 4.4"x3.3") and is meant to be kept separate from them. It was handed out as a promo item during the 2015 International Tabletop Day. Its text reads:

When a Portal adds a Dungeon, any player may choose to put the Dungeon of Superior Shopping into play instead of drawing a Dungeon from the deck.

While in this Dungeon, everyone can purchase not just levels, but Doors and Treasures!

On your turn, you may discard 300 Gold Pieces worth of Items to purchase one face-down door, 600 Gold Pieces for one face-down Treasure, and 1,000 Gold Pieces for one level, as usual.

When the Dungeon of Superior Shopping is discarded, place it back in the box. The sale of a lifetime only happens once a game, after all.

games.name: Killing Code: Venice Vendetta – Dead End Bridge
games.description:
Promo card for Killing Code: Venice Vendetta.

This card allows the player acting as the Killer use one more killing method to murder the target.

games.name: Sky, the Air-Men game
games.description:
My copy came with this equipment, but no rules:
1) Four sets of cards, numbered 1-12, with blue and white illustrations of mono-, bi-, and tri-planes, and dirigibles.
2) Four "value cards" (Distance, Altitude, Duration, and Speed) that will take any trick.
3) Four "Hazards" (Storm, Wind, Collision, and Stopped Motor) that make a trick valueless.

Appears to be pre-WWI, based on illustrations and other packaging, including rules for a different card game called "Stage" (copyright 1904) and advertising inserts for old versions of Pit and Rook.

games.name: Guido Buchwald's WM-Fun
games.description:
Objective: score most goals - try to keep your goal clean
- acting by turns -
roll the die, move, draw action cards, manipulate playing time, participate in a soccer camp, move to substitutes' bench, challenge other players with penalty shootout...
game ends at the end of the second half or if one player scores 24 goals

remarks:
Guido Buchwald is a former German soccer player

games.name: Crag
games.description:
Why do people climb rockfaces - because they are there and because they can. Well you can if the conditions are right!

In Crag they are always right. Crag is a solo dice and card game that tries to simulate some of experience of rock climbing. A route is generated from deck of cards and then the player attempts to move up it. The longer the route, the harder the moves the more tired they become. Placing gear can help if you fall, but it won't stop you falling, and you only have so much gear.

The files for Crag can be found in the files section.

games.name: 'Attack of the Boogeymen' Supplement (fan expansion for Last Night on Earth)
games.description:
'Attack of the Boogeymen' supplement is a fan created print and play for 'Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game' and features 5 classic horror character game cards.

These are made for fans to print and use in the game. They work just like normal Hero Cards in the game. NO profit is being made. Copyright to all respected parties.

Character Cards:
Ash Williams
Freddy Krueger
Jason Voorhees
Leatherface
Michael Myers
family: Last Night on Earth Game Engine
expansions: Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game

games.name: Drinking Viking
games.description:
Game idea

Drinking Viking - brand new party game born on parties and made for parties. The game consists of various short, simple and funny mini-games, where each is more fun than the last. The game encourages players to interact in many different ways. You will master the rules very quickly and the game will never feel the same, because it gives you endless possibilities to experience something new. You will see your friends in comic situations and laught at things you are able to do trying to escape punishment. While playing Drinking Viking you will learn that the art is not to win but to manage not to lose!

What’s in the box?

Drinking Viking party game contains 19 types of cards with unique illustrations shuffled in set of 42 cards, rulebook, 3 wooden dice and original cotton pouch. To play, all you need are your friends, a viking heart and gaming spirit. It is that simple. The game can be played virtually anywhere. No board, no figures, no long setup. YOU are the figures and YOU are the board!

Game mechanics

Every card represents one mini game with unique rules. Players draw cards one by one to know what kind of game they are going to play and what challenge lies ahead. Some minigames are based on words, memory or creativity, others on luck, courage and quick reactions
You will play minigames like Egg,-chicken-dragon-Viking, Loki, 2-5-7, Mad king, Thor’s hammer, Odin, Hunt , Drinking Viking and many more.

Game goal

Goal of this game is the game itself. Players try not to loose in various minigames to escape punishment. Each mini game is competitive and has unique winning goal. The goal of mini-games could be for example: beating others in rock-paper-scissors to become a Viking, hitting the table with your hand to ‘stun’ other players, following the rules made by crazy king or not being the last to row a viking ship.

Rules of each mini-game determine losers. As Drinking Viking is a party game and vikings celebrate the BIG VICTORY, losers normally consume a beverage. But you can play Stripping Viking as well as you can play it just by collecting black points which is another funny way to play.

The game ends when all cards are played. Then the winner or winners are determined depending on a game type. Winner is a player who has lowest score or the player who has the most pieces of clothing or the player who drank less than others. It is very simple to recognize winners and losers.

games.name: Sabado Gigante
games.description:
Players play as individuals or teams. Five of the six spaces on the gameboard get three cards. Each space has a separate deck with a puzzle on each card. Game one is Hangman using a historical name as a puzzle. Game two tests how well one knows the other players. Game three has the player trying to guess what noise another player is trying to make.
